turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Eni.
turn.2: In March 2018, Eni reached an agreement with MIT to fund fusion research projects run out of the MIT Plasma Science and Fusion Center (PSFC)’s newly created Laboratory for Innovation in Fusion Technologies (LIFT).
turn.4: The expected investment in these research projects will amount to about $2 million over the following years.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: As exploration and reserve replacement being major drivers for the company, Eni boosts for production additions in its core oil field areas (North and Sub-Saharan Africa, Venezuela, Barents Sea, Yamal Peninsula, Kazakhstan, Iraq and the Far East).
turn.7: Do they have any other companies?
turn.8: Eni has about 130 exploration and production subsidiaries, such as Eni Norge.
turn.9: What does the oil and gas company do?
turn.10: In 2012 Eni reported liquids and gas production for the full year of 1,701 kboe/d, this being calculated assuming a natural gas conversion factor to barrel equivalent, updated to 5,492 cubic feet of gas equal 1 barrel of oil from July 1, 2012.
turn.11: How many wells did they drill?
turn.12: During 2012 60 new exploratory wells were drilled, as 56 were drilled in 2011 and 47 in 2010.
